report_title: IBISWorld | ATV, Golf Cart & Snowmobile Manufacturing in the US Jun 2024
executive_summary: ATV, golf cart and snowmobile manufacturers have faced notable volatility through the current period. Since these products are highly discretionary, severe economic uncertainty contributed to sharp declines and weak profit. In particular, plummeting consumer confidence, volatile inflation and climbing interest rates curtailed growth. Even so, manufacturers capitalized on lockdown restrictions and stimulus checks to create massive growth opportunities in 2021. Regardless, revenue has contracted at an expected CAGR of 1.1% to $10.0 billion through the current period, despite a 0.1% jump in 2024, where profit reached 3.4%. Manufacturers also dealt with soaring input costs and supply chain disruptions.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Manufacturers have grappled with economic uncertainty
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: ATV, golf cart and snowmobile manufacturers have faced severe economic uncertainty through the current period.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: An increased interest in golf has supported cart sales
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Golf cart sales largely depend on purchases from golf course and country club owners.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Companies have faced intense external competition
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: ATV, golf cart and snowmobile manufacturers have faced intense competition from a wide range of substitutes and imported goods.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Manufacturers will continue to invest heavily in developing more fuel-efficient and green-energy ATVs, golf carts and snowmobiles.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Strong economic conditions will support growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: ATV, golf cart and snowmobile manufacturers will benefit from strong economic tailwinds through the outlook period.
Companies may prioritize various market niches to protect against generic products.

industry_definition: The ATV, Golf Cart & Snowmobile Manufacturing industry comprises establishments that primarily manufacture all-terrain vehicles (ATVs), golf carts and snowmobiles. Industry operators also manufacture parts and accessories for these vehicles.

positive_impact_factors: Time spent on leisure and sports
Demand from golf courses and country clubs

threats: Time spent on leisure and sports

key_trends: Manufacturers are investing in developing electric and solar-powered vehicles to meet changing consumer preferences and environmental regulations.
Companies are focusing on higher-end, specialized products with added features to differentiate from lower-cost imports.
Demand is cyclical and seasonal, impacted by economic conditions, weather patterns, and leisure/recreation trends.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Many manufacturers rely on various motor vehicle wholesalers to sell and distribute ATVs, golf carts and snowmobiles.
Many motorcycle dealerships sell ATVs and other specialized motor vehicles to diversify revenue streams.
Golf courses and country clubs regularly update cart fleets to replace outdated vehicles.

products_and_services.product_description: An all-terrain vehicle is a vehicle that travels on low-pressure tires.
Golf courses, retirement communities, construction companies and hospitality providers are the primary buyers of golf carts.
Manufacturers also produce other products, primarily including snowmobiles, personal watercraft and various parts for repairs.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: ATVs, golf carts and snowmobiles are discretionary purchases, heavily influenced by disposable income levels.
Consumer confidence impacts demand for discretionary recreational vehicles.
Financing costs influence demand for discretionary vehicles.
Fluctuations in prices impact demand for gas-powered vehicles.
Demand is influenced by the amount of leisure time available.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Domestic buyers rely on low-cost exporters
international_trade_points.trade_description: Imports play a key role in ATV, golf cart and snowmobile manufacturing.

international_trade_points.trade_title: The US dollar's growth supports imports
international_trade_points.trade_description: The dollar's growth has supported import growth.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Exports fall as US companies battle supply chain disruptions
international_trade_points.trade_description: Stemming from the fallout of COVID-19, US companies had to fight supply chain issues.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast claims the highest percentage of ATV, golf cart and snowmobile manufacturers.
The West region is ideal for manufacturers.
The Great Lakes region has a robust industrial base.
The Great Lakes region has a robust industrial base.
The Southeast claims the highest percentage of manufacturers.

Manufacturers rely on skilled workers for various tasks.

FAQs.answer: The largest cost component is purchases, which accounts for 72.4% of revenue.
